title: Dont let Galio ult be interrupted by modified auto attacks
body:
sometimes when i play galio and i flash ult for a 5 man taunt, the enemy leona or blitz will hit me because of the taunt but they will have the knockup or stun on next attack so it interrupts after like .5 seconds

Same thing probably also happens with braum

can these attacks not interrupt galio? that would be awesome

what OP is suggesting is a quality of life buff at the most.  It makes it so when you flash ulti their entire team, braum auto attacking BECAUSE HES TAUNTED doesnt make every other taunted champion set off a stun they had no control over.
mhm

I think it being interruptible is fine, the ult is a large multi-hitting CC that deals decent damage to fighters and tanks, and loads of damage to squishies, so having SOME way to counter it beyond QSS/Mikael's is good (and most of the empowered autos that stop it are on supports). I think a better change is making it so it's not reliant on flash to be in a good position, the last couple days there was a topic suggesting something like Aatrox's Q should be built into the ult as a gap closer, something like that would probably be nice without removing what's already a fairly limited counterpicking way of handling it.
Giving Galio a positioning tool in addition to the ultimate would make him outclass Malphite's ultimate in almost every way. NTY.

You're missing the point, the OP isn't complaining because it can be interrupted, he's complaining because taunted champions with a modified auto attack interrupt it, which no one has control over.  If you taunt Braum and a few other teammates, your ultimate is almost worthless.  If you taunt a Leona who just so happened to have activated her stun, your ultimate is almost worthless.

No one is saying he should be CC immune, just that it shouldn't be interrupted by things outside the players (any players) control.

I think this is the wrong way to buff galio. It takes counterplay away from him.

What he actually needs are manageable mama costs, and better mobility. Someone earlier mentioned that his Ult should be similar to aatrox's dark flight where he jumps up then down before the aoe. It would give him more counterplay, but also buff him at the same time.

Autoattacks being able to interrupt Galio ult is the very definition of no counterplay. Simply BEING one of the champions that can do so completely nullifies that spell completely, and the Galio has no control over that. There are so many ways to interrupt it without a stunning autoattack which fit the general idea of what counterplay for AOE should be like (AKA keep your distance, dodge it, etc). It's simply strange for an AOE ult like Galio's to have counterplay in the form of *being hit by it only if you're a champion with a certain spell*. I think this change would be a good addition to the other buffs you've brought up.
...What? Requiring Galio to not ult around enemies who can interrupt him with single use AA abilities, or after those abilities are on cooldown, *is the definition of no counterplay to you?*
Attacking someone who is forcing you to attack them isn't counterplay.  Letting the ult hit you because you are the Braum or Leona is counterintuitive.

Nobody is saying it should be immune to interruption.  Just that whoever interrupts it should have to be OUTSIDE the AoE.  Again, the point you quoted but failed to actually address in any way, ALLOWING CC TO HIT YOU SHOULD NOT BE THE RIGHT PLAY AGAINST CC.
No the fact that tenacity no loner affects the duration of the taunt is good enough. Or would you rather Nunu/fiddle/kat/Malz be affected the same way with this proposed change.

Nunu?  Maybe.  It's worth looking at.  And maybe it would mean a nerf to damage to.

Fiddle's ult isn't channeled.  The proper counterplay if you can stop it before it starts IS to stop it before it starts.  The proper counterplay to Galio's ult should NOT be to LET it taunt you.  Kat's ult isn't CC, so the same is true.  The proper play can be to cancel the channel.

Malz already has that functionality.  The target of his ult can't CC Malz in response.  (Well, CC with a travel time can do it with really good timing, but that's an edge case.)  The proper counterplay to Malz ult is an item.

I think fiddle and morgana are two champs (and kennen I believe) who even if you stun or taunt them, their ultimates will keep hitting you, and I find it funny that I once killed a thresh after he grabbed me, but still got pulled towards his dead body lol

If these champs can perform such strong moves unhindered, a little help on Galio to avoid having his ultimate cancelled isn't so bad. Immune to cc from taunted enemies? No, that is not the solution, but just a way to create a window. If his E was a silence, (or as I've said before, a charge with a knock-up) he could time his ultimate to get avoid CC, or see that it will be cancelled and pull back until an opening arises.

Maybe if you could time your ult properly and not just run in and ult at every moment you got, this wouldn't be such a problem. Is udyr in bear form? Don't taunt yet. Does Xin have his Q ready? Don't taunt yet. Simple little things make or break your usefulness as a Galio player. Don't complain because of your inferior skill.

udyr can swap to bear form when you ultimate, and his cd is too short to reliably land an ultimate while he can't swap back.

And for clarity, i mean the ultimate animation (or the flash as some use) has a delay long enough to promp AA cc, before the taunt takes effect.

Btw, saying it's down to inferior skill when the enemy has such a natural advantage is just naive. Personally, I handle champs like udyr by charging him, rather than going straight into ultimate, i hit w before he gets into range, let him stun me, watch a bunch of cc smack me around, then (if the enemy is smart enough to back off) flash ultimate them while udyr's stuns is on cd. If you land a five man ultimate, even if udyr breaks it again, you've probably stacked up maximum damage already, and your team should be using your e to follow you in anyway. That and the number of cc skills you force the enemy to waste, the biggest problem isn't Galio having his ultimate cancelled, but when Galio is the only player on your team doing well, and he has to "engage" "tank" "defend" and "deal damage" which even though there are some champs who can, there shouldn't be, and if the team isn't so weak, even a cancelled Galio ulitimate gives your team a strong opportunity to instigate and control the fight

While it would be nice, I'm against this.  I personally like Galio and I feel this would make him very strong, but for this reason, I'm against it.  If you flash ult, basically the only way someone could stop your ultimate is for them to not even be remotely close to you.  If abilities like Leona Q and Blitz E aren't allowed to knock you out of your ultimate, it makes Galio incredibly resistant to CC.  What if they weren't actually in the ultimate range when you cast it and are going in with their modified auto attack to break your ultimate?  They then would just have to stay back and won't be able to do anything(I'm going off the situation if their other abilities aren't up, for Leona her R and Blitz his Q and R).  That seems unfair imo.

I commented earlier on a point similar, I think Galio's ultimate should have a mini-silence before it triggers, stopping prompted skills, but anyone outside the ulti can go in and cancel it, and enemies like udyr and braum still affect it regardless.

But even without that, I have to add that many times I have flashed ulti when blitz or leona have not prompted their stuns, but in that window (less than a second) before the ultimate stops these skills, they get activated. I agree with some comments, just having Galio present makes the enemy team very cautious with their CC and I have won 3 consecutive teamfights without using his ultimate, just by charging in and scaring the enemy out of position. I love him and how he can be played, but every once in a while I get this bug where I ulti, it gets cancelled before it triggers, and I get locked into the ultimate posture but without casting it. I just think stopping enemies from just tapping that AA CC "As" they get taunted is unfair, they should either have it primed before hand, or they be outside and activate it, so somehow closing the window where they can counter it would be nice.

But to be fair, something much simpler would make Galio's life easier, if his ultimate is cancelled, reduce the cd of the spell, not a lot, but from 3 minutes to 2, most of his opponents have such short ultimate cd that even though he counters them, if they are just aggressive enough they can hit their ultimates twice before he can use one that is very difficult to land or get in range with

Shorter cd if its cancelled, and turn his e into a charge and his spells would synergize much better without taking away counter play options

Would probably work pretty well if his ult applied a debuff to enemies that were caught in it when it was first cast that disabled on hit CC only on them, so if you are playing Leona or something you can still use the Q to stop the ult just only if you were outside of it when it was cast.
outplayed

Make it a charm rather than a taunt and give it bonus damage for each charmed champion within his AoE.

Or

Lower the base damage, make the explosion radius bigger, have it do multiple waves of small taunt/charms and have him CC immune during it.

His ultimate looks like it should suck people in hence the charm effect.
